item.title: Visual Code Testing Notes
item.description: Visual Code Testing Get code scope VS Code comes with a built-in tool to easily obtain the scope of a piece of syntax. Press ctrl + shift + P, for the command pallette to show up, then type dev, and choose ‘Developer: Inspect TM Scopes’ option. This will show you the selected token's scope. There are four sections: Custom theme highlighting keywords in the settings file “editor.tokenColorCustomizations”: { “[One Dark Pro]": { “textMateRules”: [ { “scope”: [ “keyword.
